@graph.name: Mio Telematics Integration - Connected Vehicle Platform - Route4Me Platform
@graph.description: Mio Technology Corporation, a subsidiary of MiTAC International Corporation, is a Taiwanese electronics maker that manufactures and markets Pocket PCs, Personal Digital Assistants (PDAs), smartphones and Personal Navigation Devices (PNDs). It sells products under the Navman" and " Mio" brands. Mio Technology currently has operations in Taiwan, China, Japan, South Korea, Australia, New Zealand, and Europe. Mio Technology is among the world's top three personal navigation device vendors, which also includes TomTom International BV and Garmin Ltd. Currently, they make Car and Bicycle Navigation Units and Dashboard Cameras."
@graph.keywords: Mio integration, fleet telematics, connected vehicle platform, GPS tracking, driver monitoring, route optimization, fleet management, commercial fleet solutions, Route4Me platform, vendor-agnostic telematics

additionalProperty.name: Driver's behavior monitoring
additionalProperty.value: A driver behavior monitoring system is a technology-driven solution that continuously tracks and analyzes how drivers operate their vehicles. By using vehicle telematics, GPS and various in-vehicle sensors, the system collects data on driving actions - speed, acceleration, braking and cornering - to provide real-time insights into driver performance.

additionalProperty.name: Real-time Dashcam capture
additionalProperty.value: Real-time dashcam capture is increasingly becoming a valuable feature within telematics systems, enhancing fleet management and safety. By integrating video with traditional telematics data like GPS location, speed and driving behavior, it provides a comprehensive view of vehicle and driver activity, enabling proactive safety measures and efficient incident response.
